Evaluation_Questions: How well did this course, to the extent promised in the syllabus, enable “conversation across lines of difference,” integrate practical and theoretical concerns, or consider and integrate issues of class, gender/sexuality, race/ethnicity, dis/ability, and or global/cultural diversity
Comments_Questions: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your Teaching Fellow as an instructor and how might his/her teaching be improved
What was the name of your practicum instructor
What were her/his strengths or weaknesses
Comments_List: Dylan is a talented thinker and I have no doubt that he will become a great scholar and a marvelous professor.

It would be helpful to have more time in section devoted to preparing for the quiz/tests. I think Sara's method of having someone assigned to present on the readings would also better facilitate discussion and create less tangents on to topics such as Buddhism

Strength: Dylan brings a refreshing perspective to his sections. He is able to clearly articulate the abstract concepts in the text. He made sure every voice is heard in section, and I appreciate his helpful feedback on papers/quizzes.

Weakness: our sections were often disorganized and didnt follow the weekly questions to prepare us for the quizzes.
I loved how Sarah prepared each section with intentionality and creativity. Sometimes, I felt that a bit too much emphasis was given to Jewish thought, but not too much.
Sarah was awesome!  She truly cares for the students and makes herself available for students to get help.  Thanks!
Strengths: organizing the classes well, showing respect for different voices.

Sarah is brilliant. I am extremely grateful to have had section with her. Shes a great teacher and was always patient with me. She excels at creating an environment where discussion, questioning, and exploration are encouraged.

She could be overly strict and demanding sometimes. However, it was clear she cared a great deal about students and understood the subject matter thoroughly. Her office hours and open communication was very appreciated.

Sarah was an incredible Teaching Fellow who always had a plan for our discussions. This I would say was her greatest strength that she had a clear and concise teaching plan for each discussion. She also made herself available through office hours throughout the term making it easy on students to approach her and ask plenty of questions. She was exceptionally knowledgeable and a wonderful teaching. The only weakness I can attest too is that sometimes Sarah speaks incredible fast and I was not always able to keep up.
I liked the innovative approach to discussion sections. They were always very task/skill focused which was much appreciated, in addition to an opportunity to engage in discussion.
